review.title: Greatet Hotel.  Great Staff
review.reviewText:
We traveled to San Francisco for a family trip.  Larkspur Landing South San Francisco was a great choice for us to stay at. Located close to the Airport and close to transportation including commuter Train station only 12 minute walk from the hotel.  The commuter "Cal-train" takes you right downtown San Francisco in about 20 minutes.  Making this hotel an economical alternative to potentially expensive downtown San Francisco hotels.  
This is a "suite" hotel giving you a small kitchen area with fridge, stove, sink, dishes, etc.  If you plan to stay in San Francisco for a few to several days, this is a great home base to travel from.  I would highly recommend the Larkspur Landing.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good proximity for transportation to Airport, Downtown, and available Car Rentals.  Friendly accommodating staff.
review.negativeRemarks: An improvement would to make available a Suite with 2 real beds.  Instead of a great King Size bed and an uncomfortable pull out.  We booked 4 guests.

Though clean, the maintenance is not good, the bath tub liner was chipped, the drapes didn't work properly, the AC didn't benefit the separate bedroom and the decor is dated.  It probbaly was a lovely property 20 years ago. It is a 'good value' for a reason, it does not measure up to other properties and will leave you dissapointed. Oh well.

review.title: Convenient location near freeway
review.reviewText: Staff were civil, but not what I would call friendly. Had to walk through an employee's cigarette smoke to enter the hotel. Continental breakfast offerings were way at the lower end of the scale; a lot of pre-packaged stuff--one employee was seen walking all over (outside of the food area... including around the reception area) with an open bag of hard-cooked, pre-peeled eggs. The bed in the room was situated in such a way that you could not prop up against the headboard nd watch TV; the TV was to the side of the bed. One could also not easily maneuver around the other side of the bed and avoid banging a knee or shin into the A/C unit. The surfaces all seemed just a little bit sticky... and the room smelled as though someone had stir-fried a bunch of peppers and onions and then closed up the room. I opened the window, but the smell remained for the length of my stay. Advertisements boasted HBO, and there was an HBO guide... but no HBO; the channel was there... was just blank the entire length of my stay. Having a DVD player in the room was a nice touch, but, alas, I don't tend to travel with DVDs.

review.title: Great hotel for budget minded family
review.reviewText: I booked the Larkspur Landing in South San Francisco for my family of five. It was a great choice. We were driving to San Francisco from Southern California. We stayed in the "Grand Suite". It had a separate bedroom with two double beds and a pull out couch in the living room. The bathroom was large. There was a full little kitchen (stove top, microwave, dishwasher, full size fridge, coffee maker). There was a big dining table with swivel chairs. I guess for business people they could use the room to have meetings. There was a white board behind a wood frame/cover on the wall. The kids loved it!  There was a TV in the living room and the bedroom. My only complaint is that there wasn't a fan/air-conditioner&heater in the bedroom and so the room could get stuffy. Having a fan in the room also helps to block out incidental noise from the other rooms and so we could hear footsteps, children running around upstairs, etc. Other than that, the room was very great. The breakfast is decent. Nothing hot, but lots of cereals, bagels, pastries, toast, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea, and hard boiled eggs on two of the days we were there. Be warned - The breakfast is only from 6-9 Monday - Friday so if you have a big crew to wake up and get ready you might want to send someone down and bring up breakfast for everyone. The hotel always has water, coffee and tea available, as well as apples and chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon. San Francisco is only 10 min. away by car.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to San Francisco, large room, free breakfast, parking and WIFI.
review.negativeRemarks: A fan unit in the separate bedroom of the Grand Suite would be good to have. It got stuffy each night and it also helps to drown out noise.
review.locationRemarks: Only 10 minutes away from San Francisco by car. Close to the airport, but in a nice area. Gas, Starbucks nearby and banks near.

review.title: Charles Dickens Faire Trip
review.reviewText: My friend and I chose this hotel because it was the better cost-effective option for us for our weekend trip. We wanted a hotel that was close to Cow Palace. After a good amount of time comparing multiple hotels with Lyft and Uber travel prices, we ultimately selected this hotel based off other reviews, photos provided, free continental breakfast, free airport shuttle, and freshly baked cookies. The cookies however, were practically nonexistent. We arrived at 8:50 and no cookies were found. We arrived back at the hotel the next day and at 7, there was only one cookie left. We wished there were more cookies. We also liked the idea of a book and movie library that the hotel advertised, but the it was worded made appear that it was an extensive wall-to-wall collection, when in fact it was a mere 2-page list of 60 movies or less.  Small points aside, the room was spacious and we over-all enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Quiet location, yet still fairly close to the city
review.reviewText:
The pluses at this hotel are the free breakfast (continental style), the free parking, that it's clean and appears relatively new or at least well maintained, and that they have uncommonly comfortable beds (BIG plus in my opinion), which is hard to find with any consistency except in all but the priciest hotels.  My wife wanted to steal one of the pillows she liked it so much and we had a restful night's sleep virtually every night.  Guests were, by and large, quiet and well behaved as well, not a lot of "riffraff", such as tend to patronize other competitively priced hotels. Otherwise, this was a fairly basic, no frills hotel--which is exactly what I like.  I don't want to pay for or otherwise subsidize a lot of amenities that I won't use while on vacation.  However, as a fitness enthusiast, I was disappointed by the size and offerings in their fitness center.  Just a few light free weights and a couple treadmills as I recall, all in a stuffy little room.  If you're desperate and motivated, I guess it's better than nothing.  I got a fairly reasonable rate through Expedia, which made the stay there very competitively priced for the locale.

It is located close to and just north of SFO and right off Hwy 101, so quick access to the City (traffic notwithstanding) and in an otherwise quiet, business neighborhood--so seemingly fairly safe. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and won't hesitate to return.
review.positiveRemarks:
Comfortable beds and pillows
Free breakfast
Free parking
Reasonably priced (at least via the prepaid Expedia rate)
review.negativeRemarks:
Better fitness accommodations
Provide complimentary bottled water in room (like the Hampton Inn does)
Better selection of oatmeal in morning
review.locationRemarks:
Easy access to SFO and fairly close to the city
Seeminglyh not much to do or eat in the immediate vicinity, but we didn't look too hard

There were some faults (Disney channel was the shopping channel... not good with an 18 mth old, bed side lamps did not work properly, no high chair available for breakfast and gym was a little pokey) but the staff were accommodating and did offer for us to move rooms. The freshly baked cookies available in the afternoon is a great idea, especially after a day of exploring SF. Plenty of free parking for vehicles. Having a suite with cooking facilities makes the hotel feel a little more homely. I personally feel the rooms could do with a slight touch of TLC to improve its feel.

review.title: Lots of included services
review.reviewText: Overall it was good. There's no real ambiance but lots of included things. They have a kitchen in the room, free laundry room, free wifi, free parking, free continental breakfast. It's about 20 minutes to San Francisco from the hotel and they have free shuttles. Well worth it. Parking at hotels in SF costs $60 on top of your room rate. The room needed a little extra attention tho. There was a nasty wax covered q-tip on the bathroom floor. The toilet paper roll was almost empty. In the kitchen the paper towel roll was almost empty and there's no ice or sodas on the second floor. They will shop for groceries for you for free if you have your order in by 10am ... and it will be there by the evening. I thought that was cool. There's no view so leave your windows closed and there's a DVD player in the room. Good value for the money.

review.reviewText: Arrived at 3pm (which is their check-in time) and was told it would be AT LEAST another hour before our room was ready and there was nothing we could do to speed it along.  Normally this wouldn't be a big deal but we had traveled in a cramped car for 6 hours and had to leave within an hour to make it to a game in the city.  They wouldn't let me do any of the check in process like running my card, signing paper and getting keys until the room was actually ready so we were stuck in the lobby with my three kids just waiting and hoping they would get done sooner than expected.  It was very frustrating, although the staff WAS very friendly.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  We had a small suite with two queen beds and a sofa bed.  The only complaint about the room was that the bathroom door was a pocket slider and had no way to lock it.  Three year olds are notorious for not allowing anyone any privacy so not having a lock was . . . entertaining :). Bottom line, the staff was friendly and the room was clean so I guess I would stay again.  But then again, there are a lot of hotels in the area so I would probably try my luck with another one first.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and clean room.  Friendly front desk staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Allowing people to at least do the check in process if their room is not ready by the hotels documented check in time.
review.locationRemarks: Close to resteraunts, gas stations, freeway and airport.  Easy to get to ATT park!

review.reviewText:
Hotel staff was absolutely amazing during my stay here. Always smiling, saying hello, and very helpful. 
Complimentary breakfast was great!! Every morning there was fresh coffee, hard boiled eggs, string cheese, pastries galore, cereal, yogurt, juices, the list goes on....Very healthy selections!
The hotel could use some renovations. The elevator got stuck a few times. 
The free shuttle to the airport was great! 

Location of hotel was great for business goers only, or if you have a car. My fiance and I did not have a car and when we wanted dinner at night the only option was pizza delivery or Wendys.

review.title: Dirty, Gross, Cant Believe My Stay.
review.reviewText:
We checked in fine, man was very friendly. Elevator was posset possessed, it would never go to the floor you wanted, took me 20 mins to get to the main floor, I would have taken the stairs had I not had 5 bags of luggage, The floor in the elevator feels like you are going to fall through. when we get to our room things looked ok, until we went into the bathroom, where hair was everywhere, Tub, walls, floor. Then to make matter worse we found a used condom in our bed, absolutely can not make this up. When we called the front desk they said they couldn't do anything about it until we talked to a manager, who wasn't on duty. until the following morning. we had to sleep on the floor.

When morning came we never got a call, we had to walk down and bring up the issue once again where they sent us to a housekeeping manager who was in shock they didn't move us to a new room right away. she then moved us, after all that. This place is gross. I would not recommend. Unless you like unwanted things in your bedding.

review.title: Really nice hotel for a great value.
review.reviewText:
As I was planning my trip to the Bay Area, I am looking for a room just to shower and sleep, so I was not looking to spend over $100, which is very difficult in this area. I originally booked another "Inn," but after doing further research, I found it seemed to be horrible with rumors of the forbidden "B" word: bedbugs. After reading several reviews which mentioned this, I immediately cancelled my reservation and found Larkspur Landing. It had great reviews and looked pretty cozy and homy with all of the modern amenities. 

When we arrived, the staff were very friendly, it was in a good area and there was ample parking. The room was a great deal for what I paid and the breakfast was great, as there were a ton of options every morning. They also bake cookies every evening which was a really nice treat. I stayed there for 9 days and found myself a bit sad when we left. It felt very warm and inviting and was a great place to stay. I will most definitely stay there again the next time I visit.
review.positiveRemarks: The environment was very warm and inviting and the amenities offered were outstanding.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds and pillows were a bit squishy and uncomfortable, but I prefer that is a bit more solid.
review.locationRemarks: Location was very close to the city, and not too bad of a drive if heading towards Silicon Valley

review.title: Spacious, clean & comfortable rooms.
review.reviewText: I gave an overall rating of a 4 because the hotel was a nice place to stay, the rooms were very spacious. We got a standard king and there was a mini kitchen, office and couch space which was entirely separate from the bedroom which is the "all suite" part of the location. However, I had specifically requested the highest floor, in hopes there would be a view. The hotel staff confirmed the 4th floor was what had been requested during booking and then told me it wouldn't be available unless I didn't mind the wet paint in the room. Mind you, I marked on that same request that I would be arriving at 6 pm NOT 3 pm normal check in, so they had time to take care of this. Surely it wasn't an issue, I simply took a different room...but that wasn't the point. I was pleased with the size of the room and the cleanliness as well as how many towels, soap etc. were in the room for use. However, again a bit disappointed when I changed into my bathing suit to visit there "spa"... 1st of all, the water was about the outside temperature (70), if we were lucky maybe 5 degrees higher. The button used to turn the jets on wasn't working and obviously the heater wasn't either, but there was no sign in sight about it being broken or anyone telling us this when we expressed we were excited to check out the spa...Walked back up to the room to call it a night and turned on the shower... the shower had some obnoxious noise coming from it the hole time like there was air in the pipes.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were friendly, free fresh baked cookies was a plus. Breakfast cereal, fruit and yogurt were complimentary.
review.negativeRemarks: Spa wasn't working, no signs posted
review.locationRemarks:
I recommend staying in this area for sure. It's 15 minutes to downtown area, 20 to the piers
and WAY better than staying right in the hectic city!

review.title: Deceiving reviews
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel for the price if you need a place to stay for cheap while visiting San Fran. We needed a place to stay while we visited the wharf and Alcatraz. I read a lot of reviews for this hotel and was a bit skeptical, I read things like absolutely messy gross rooms and uncourteous staff. This was not the case. My girlfriend and I found the hotel to be above average. The room we stayed in was clean, linens were nice, and having a full kitchenette was a score too. They have a actually really good breakfast selection, which we found so many people complained about on expedia, but we stocked up with no hassle. Yes, there is only one table to sit at and eat breakfast, but seriously people, its a hotel not a restaurant. There is a iHop just a few blocks away, and tons of resturaunts. We had a DVD player in the room that didn't work either, but after telling the front desk staff they had someone fix it immediately which was awesome. They also have a small gym and a outdoor smaller hot tub which nobody really used the entire time we were there, so it was easy to take advantage of after a long day at the wharf.

review.title: Easy access to freeway
review.reviewText:
I was in San Francisco for a 50 yr. grammar school reunion and wanted to find a hotel within 10-15 minutes from the event.  The Larkspur. located in So. SF (near Brisbane) was perfect and the room rates through Expedia are extremely competitive with other hotels in the area.  The hotel is located in a business park and is very close to the 101 freeway and to the airport.  

The staff was pleasant and helpful.  The room was clean and there was plenty of room to move around.  I was there for only one night; but for longer stays the full kitchen is a very nice feature (which I understand is in every room).  The room was a bit warm and stuffy when I checked in (probably because the windows in my room faced West), so I did have to turn the air conditioner on; but I had to turn it to a very low temperature (65) in order to kick on and stay on.

I agree with other reviewers regarding the breakfast.  It does get a bit crowded at peak times and there really is no room to sit down in the area as there is only one table, a couch and a couple of chairs.  Knowing this in advance, I planned in advanced to take my bagel and tea back to my room.  A suggestion would be to provide small trays for guests to carry their food and drink back to their rooms.

All in all, it was a pleasant stay and I would stay again.

managementResponses.response:
Hello,
We are pleased to read that your stay with us at the Larkspur Landing South San Francisco exceeded your expectations. Our ready to sue kitchenettes are wonderful for the guest wishing to cook a homemade meal. It's nice that you were able to make full use of the amenities available as well as enjoy some of the wonderful restaurants on Grand Avenue. We are looking forward to your next visit.
Warmly,
The South San Francisco Larkspur Landing Team

review.title: All the comforts of home
review.reviewText: This was our first time to Larkspur Landing.  We were very impressed.  The front desk staff were very nice, and our room was clean and efficient.  Dishes, pots and pans, even Tupperware.  We were staying for three days, so it was nice to be able to prepare some meals at "home", rather than eat out every meal, especially at San Fran prices!  They had fresh cookies every afternoon, coffee and iced water always, and it was a short walk (for us) or drive to Grand Ave, where you can find many ethnic restaurants.  (try DiNapolis Italian....so good!)   We have family in San Francisco, so we will be staying again for sure, including a graduation next spring.  We will also have other family stay here. review.title: Recommended Stay
review.reviewText:
This is a very clean hotel and staff was very accommodating.  When we got to our room, the AC did not work BUT we found out it was not plugged in, the TV did not work (it had to be reset), and the phone system did not work when trying to get the front desk.  Fortunately we were two doors away from the front desk and my husband taked to them.  They promptly were in the room to correct the problems.  

They do have a cold breakfast each morning and what they had was good.  On the down side, it it is held in an area off the reception area, but it only contains one table, along with a couch and two side chairs.  If the table is occupied, you must use the couch or side chairs and balance your food on your lap or return to your room.  

Overall it was a pleasant stay in a nice area of So. SF, and we would definitely give it a try again if needed.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very conveniently located within 5-10 minutes to San Francisco airport. The desk staff is the best I have ever experienced. They had maps for us, transit information, directions and best things to do for a brief evening. It was about a 20 minute drive to Fishermans Wharf.

The hotel was very clean and they offered a self serve breakfast with oatmeal, toast, bagels, cereal, fresh fruit. Coffee and tea are always in the lobby with cookies. We were encouraged by the staff to fill up a bag of snacks for the road trip! We had a very early morning and the desk staff put together breakfast for us as it would not be open yet. Free shuttle to and from the airport was also offered every twenty minutes.

This hotel is rated excellent!!! I've stayed twice now (beginning and end of our road trip) and highly recommend it to anyone.

review.title: What is "light cleaning"
review.reviewText:
WARING: YOUR ROOM WILL BE LEFT AS IS UNLESS YOU ASK FOR IT TO BE CLEANED.
Spent the day in wine country and when we returned later that night, the room was exactly as we left it. Towels on the floor in the bathroom, trash in the kitchen trash can and bed un-made. Went to the lobby to find out WHY and all the person at the front desk could say was "the room was set for light cleaning". When ask who had set it, he had no answer. I asked what "light cleaning" is and he says they just take out the trash and replace any used towels. Really? Well they did a CRAPPY job at that. There is a notice that to "conserve", the staff won't make your bed unless you place the notice on the bed and I did but the room was still a mess. Went back down to the lobby the next morning to speak with the Manager and was flat out LIED to. Was told she was in a meeting and unavailable but a few minutes later walked through the door in street clothes.
review.negativeRemarks: Either clean your room or make it CLEAR well before booking that your hotels room will be left disgusting.

review.reviewText:
For $180/night, the room is very small. The old fashion air conditioner and aging refrigerator add unbearable noise in this tiny suite. The shower space has no walls nor in a tub, the water flows easily to the bathroom floor.

It offers a free breakfast, but the breakfast room is very small too and has only one table (with four chairs), one three-person sofa and a one-person sofa. The food is very limited. I guess it means for you to grab some food and get out of there.

Other than that, the staffs are friendly and they offer free coffee all day around.

review.title: San Francisco Larkspur Landing
review.reviewText: Great hotel only stayed there for a weekend but had great service.. rooms were good size, I loved that they provided all utensils for the kitchen great pluss there.. would love to go back...

review.title: Always a great stay
review.reviewText: Second time staying here for a SF Giants game. Locked in my rate months before and got a great deal! $87/night for three nights (fri-sun). We love the clean facility. Clean room and very comfortable. No complaints. Highly recommended. Make sure you check dates and prices. Generally rooms go for $119-139/night, which is still very worth the price. Check for specials and book in advance for a great deal. Go Giants!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. Clean, quiet, comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: A pool would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: 10 min drive from Down Town SF!

review.title: Very clean and spacious !
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly. I love that they had a kitchen.

review.title: Excellent hotel choice
review.reviewText: Room was very large and comfortable. Almost like an apartment rather than a hotel room. Pleasantly surprised room had a separate bedroom. Bed was very comfy. Parking was free and ample. Very safe location but more in a commercial setting. We will difinately stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Fresh baked cookies and fruit in lobby.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: We were in town for a soccer tournament. We also had our dog (a bloodhound) with us. They upgraded us to the largest room (no charge). It was perfect--I wish we were there for more than one night! The only issues we had were a broken blind in the bedroom (we informed the front desk at checkout and they took an immediate note) and the lack of a thermostat (would be nice, as it is too noisy to keep windows open). Other than those very minor issues, it was very clean, very well-kept, and we were very comfortable. The beds were fantastic!

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: this was conveniently located to the airport. the room was very nice w/kitchen. the so-called breakfast was really nothing i could eat (bad carb stuff). i was a bit miffed at 2 staff folks at the front desk who, when asked which direction the airport was, told me the wrong way, which took another 15 minutes to get straight by asking several people on the roadsides.
review.positiveRemarks: kitchen, bathtub, bed - all good w/wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: i can't imagine that b'fast items can get any better, but the staff REALLY should know which direction the airport is!
review.locationRemarks: only stayed one night - didn't do anything except take a bath, watch a little TV & sleep. it was my last stop before flight out.

review.title: Great for Business Stay or extended Vacation Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in South San Francisco in the business district. Lots of parking and is close to the Airport without the noise of the airport. Rooms come with Refrigerator (Full Size) cook top range,microwave,dish washer and dishes so if you wanted to save on food cost you could stock the fridge and eat in. The hotel was quiet and the staff was nice. They did have a shuttle but I had my car so I can't really say how convenient the Public transportation would be.
review.positiveRemarks: Set up for extended Stay

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in safe business area. Close to airport, major highways in SF Bay Area. Rooms are suites that are comfortable, but showing a bit of wear. Still very comfortable hotel.

review.title: Loved the Stay
review.reviewText: They stay was great as always. This is my 3rd time staying at this hotel. the staff is hard working and the hotel is always clean. I love the beds and all the amenities. Did I mention they give free fresh baked cookies :)
review.positiveRemarks: everything
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast choices

review.title: Wonderful Chinese New Years
review.reviewText: First time here and will return. It is very close to the city, about a 10 minutes drive.
Our stay was very good. I would have been happier if we were not put in a HANDICAP room.

review.title: The smell in the room was indescribable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and surroundings are good.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell in the room is the biggest issue. Furnitures and kitchen hardware are out-dated.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText:
The floors must not be insulated very well. We had to change rooms due to noisy people upstairs, but could still hear people stomping around at night....

Rooms were nice but furniture was very stained and nasty. We had to put sheets on the couch...

The hotel overall was nice and the staff was very very nice!

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: It is a very family friendly hotel. Nice and big suite with dinning and kitchen. Plus, it offered free laundry facility to use.
review.positiveRemarks: Pretty much everything except breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The heater didn't work well during our stay. It was 80 degree, and we called the staff to fix it, but it did't work properly.
review.locationRemarks: It is next to the SF airport and about 12 miles from the downtown SF.

review.title: Apartment -ish
review.reviewText: This hotel honestly feels like you're staying at someone's apartment (not in a bad way)! It's cute, the staff is super friendly, and it has everything you need! If you are looking for something "luxurious" this place may not be for you. It is more down to earth and "homey". The hotel is completely clean, nice, and kept up. If you are planning to stay in the San Fran area a couple of nights, then this place is a great choice. The rooms are very roomy and the bathrooms are definitely upgraded. Full size kitchen so you can cook!! They serve a small breakfast every morning and bake fresh cookies every night!!! What's not to love? My husband and I definitely enjoyed our stay and we would recommended it to anyone in a heart beat!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It was really close to the airport yet very quiet, limited tv channels, AMAZING staff, outdoor hot tub.

review.title: Love this place!
review.reviewText: Shuttle to Union Square, everything you need for the comforts of home. Nice people, Chris was great for helping us with early check in.

review.title: Decent hotel room if you need apartment style
Great hotel central to everything in the Bay Area!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable accommodations with modern kitchens and wonderful beds. Nice little balcony off the bedroom made for a nice chance to soak up the fresh air. Wonderful staff. Parking is easy. Lots of grassy areas for pets. Definitely recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff and accommodations.
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO airport yet no plane noise. Right off the 101 freeway for easy access in all directions.

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText:
This hotel is great if you are in town for business and you need something near the airport. It is not so good if you want to spend time in San Francisco (downtown, bay area). It is a nice property but it is in the industrial / corporate neighborhood so nothing is walking distance.
Despite these, they offer a complimentary shuttle to downtown that worked for us.
We got a bigger suite which was nice but the cleaning staff did not wash dishes.
review.positiveRemarks: Very comfortable, big suites , nice breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning (dishes)
review.locationRemarks: nothing is near by

review.title: Didn't Expect Much & Still Disappointing
review.reviewText:
We flew in from Japan to SFO late afternoon and had reserved 1 room for 1 night to totally crash before heading into SF proper to Le Meridien. Check in was easy, they upgraded us to a "better" room, it was quiet and the bed was fine. However, the reason for the 3 rating is this:
--it was not clean (deep dust layer on baseboards--I dropped something near a bed table and wow; and when I moved the amenities holder there was dirt, hair and dust; glasses had residue on them--may have been soap deposits)
--old furniture (my husband and I were both afraid to sit on the fabric sofa)
--outdated overall
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to SFO airport.

review.title: Great Place Close to SF Airport
review.reviewText: Overall, we enjoyed staying at the hotel, and would do so again. The suite arrangement was great and the double sink in the bathroom was very helpful. The staff was friendly and courteous. The shuttle to the airport departed a little late but we arrived with ample time to catch our plane. The continental breakfast was good, but the room in which it was served was small, had very few tables, and was generally not well suited to eating breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: The suite arrangement, the twin sinks in the bathroom, the proximity to the airport, the free airport shuttle service.
review.negativeRemarks: The area for the continental breakfast could be improved...too few tables and too few seats.
review.locationRemarks: We just wanted something close to the airport.

review.title: Hotel very far from the city centre
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very very far from city centre and the nearest public transport is nearly a one mile walk! It takes more than 1 hour by bus/ train to reach downtown which is a complete deal-breaker. The hotel runs a shuttle but ONLY on Friday & Saturdays which is clearly insufficient for daily use.
Other than that, the hotel is otherwise nice though pricey

review.title: Excellent amenities
review.reviewText: This hotel has everything a traveler needs-kitchen in your room, laundry facilities, internet, free breakfast, cookies in the evening, shuttle to/from airport.
review.negativeRemarks: The only problem was at breakfast there was nowhere to sit. The living room area was pretty, but tables and chairs would be more practical.

review.title: Home from home
review.reviewText: We stayed here between moving out of our house and leaving for an overseas posting. The staff were great and the basic amenities and facility just right. They accomodated our dog as well, a big plus.

review.title: Mediocre place for the money. You could do better
review.reviewText: They have this policy where you're charged a refundable deposit so long as your not a disruptive guest. It's just for show as our neighbors were very loud and when I called to provide the feedback noise just continued on until past midnight. Breakfast isn't very good and the setup is awful. They get an A for effort but we ended up stacking up our paper plate with eggo-waggles and fruit and putting drinks in our pockets to eat in our room due to lack of seating.
review.positiveRemarks: Very easy to get to. Fast elevators and nice bathrooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is kind of a joke. There is no where to really sit and the selection is toaster variety waffles and french toast.
review.locationRemarks: Very easy access to 101 and the airport. Hardly any traffic down here. Close to very good eating.

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: my husband and I stayed here the night before my Nike Women's Marathon run in SF. I searched for hotels in the city but they were extremely expensive and the ones that were reasonable were located in a not so good area or it's a torn down hotel with shared bathrooms. So we opt out to go further and find a nicer hotel.. I read a lot of good reviews so decided to book it. Staff was nice, the place was clean, but the door to our room was hard to open. It kept getting jammed.. Not a real big issue.. Also, if comfy pillows are a must for you, I recommend to bring your own. Their pillows have no fluff what so ever and has those plastic linings so you can hear it swoosh everytime you move. Those are the only cons I have about the hotel. So what was I impressed about?? We planned on driving to the city to the nike expo, but I was a bit hesitant when we found out there was major traffic due to Bart being on strike. However, the hotel provided complimentary shuttle service to Union Square! Exactly where we needed to go!! We got there in a snap because buses have there own lanes.. Kudos!!

review.title: Great hotel amenities and friendly staff!
review.reviewText: I ran the nike women's half marathon this weekend and I asked the hotel staff if it would be possible to get a late checkout so I could shower afterward and not worry about packing the night before. The staff was very understanding and let us checkout late for free! The hotel amenities were also great - continental breakfast, warm cookies, etc. I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for a great price. The suite was perfect for my young family and the fully stocked kitchen was extremely convenient. Only complaint was that there wasn't very much space for breakfast seating. That wouldn't hold me back from staying again.

review.title: convenient location
review.reviewText: It's close to Ihop, Denny's, Costco, etc. Easy to get on and off highway 101.
review.positiveRemarks: the small kitchen.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel environment fair, is the hotel offers free breakfast is too poor. I also met a fire in the middle of the night

review.title: First warning?
review.reviewText: An unusual request to sign a written warning that you will be quiet are be evicted to all guest that registar a stay at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Large spacious rooms with complete kithcen.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Airport and Candelstick park.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Would definitely come back to this hotel. Very clean great customer service.

review.title: 1 night stay while passing through
review.reviewText: The suite was more than sufficient for our 1 night stay before catching flight early next morning. Lots of room, would easily have accommodated a bigger group. Because of our flight time could not take advantage of continental breakfast offer, so would be nice if some flexibility / options were available for early morning travellers. No on site restaurant. No pool/hot tub amenities. Otherwise, we had everything we needed. Staff was helpful. Shuttle service was convenient. Thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: Suite was roomy and clean. Service was fast. Shuttle was convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: More options for ordering light meals, an onsite convenience store, a hot tub, some outdoor relaxation space.
review.locationRemarks: Location was convenient to airport; otherwise location was nothing to write home about.

review.title: My new go to spot
review.reviewText:
This place was a great little spot. The outside is nice and very well lit parking lot. The inside is clean and up to date. There is no old dingy stained carpet or walls it's clean

The room was smaller than I expected. But after staying for 3 days I realized it is very roomy just not a deep looking room as you walk in. The kitchen area is very clean and the staff is great.

Only bad thing was I asked for a wake up call and never got it. Luckily my iphone woke me up before but the call never came.

They have free DVD rentals at the front desk which was nice when I just wanted to relax.

Downtown south frisco is about 5 min away. I are at Cecelia, Jacob is the owner and the food is great. Tell him Oz from San Diego recommended it.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: This was perfect for my three month old, husband and myself for a six night stay... It was like living in a apartment loved the free laundry facility....
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the free laundry facility!!!

review.title: Great bargain
review.reviewText: Convenient location to SF (and airport if that's important). FREE parking and WiFi (huge for us). An OK breakfast. Great staff. Room was good-sized (nice kitchen area, although we did not use it).
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location to SF (and airport if that's important). FREE parking and WiFi (huge for us). An OK breakfast. Great staff. HD-TV.
review.negativeRemarks: More breakfast variety.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to SF if you have a car. Shuttle to airport if necessary.

review.title: Nice hotel. Loved being able to cook
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Good selection for breakfast the first morning, but limited on second day.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Candlestick Park
review.reviewText: Exercise room was equipped with one treadmill, stair-stepper, free weights and a stationary bike. No pool available. Sofa was old but comfortable - suggest they upgrade the sofa. Bathroom & bedroom was spacious and clean. Kitchen had plates, pots & pans but no cutlery - had to call the hotel staff for that. Continental breakfast was OK but other hotels have a wider selection of items.
review.positiveRemarks: Price & convenience
review.negativeRemarks: Continental Breakfast, upgrade the sofa sleeper and install a pool.
review.locationRemarks: Candlestick Park

review.title: Great value for South San Francisco
review.reviewText: great stay - clean rooms, great and friendly staff
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for Candlestick games

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: I love my room It was very comfortable , like the bed and bathroom was clean and big, there was big kitchen with every thing and two tv one in living room and one in bedroom. the breakfast was include too. I recommend this hotel to my friends and family
review.positiveRemarks: very comfortable

review.title: Ticks all the boxes
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, friendly. Breakfast was ok. All very typical of Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn style hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Free laundry was very handy
review.negativeRemarks: Tv is in an awkward position to watch from the bed.
review.locationRemarks: We stayed here to go to a 49ers game, be aware of the flat rate of $45 the taxi drivers charge for the 5 minute ride to the stadium.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Loved the Hotel and personnel. All staff associates where very nice, friendly and professional.
The Hotel is very conveniently located close to the airport and only about 10-15 Minutes from Fishermans Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location. Hotel was kept clean and pleasant. I loved the continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: I woul have liked the AC to be able to cool the suite better, also some of the funiture showed signs of aging and
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect. Very close to San Francisco and to the airport.

review.title: nice hotel. feels like home.
review.reviewText: it really feels home sweet home. if you are far from home, this could be a pleasant experience for you.

review.title: Great hotel, close to airport
review.reviewText: Complimentary shuttle from airport to hotel! Late check-in, big room, clean, not expensive, comfortable bed. All what you need after a long flight! drawback, only 1 place to buy your meals.

review.title: Great choice in San Francisco area.
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay near San Francisco. The room was very nice and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful, giving us a great recommendation for dinner and info on transportation to downtown. They provided a shuttle to the San Fran airport nearby where we caught the BART train to downtown and Fisherman's Wharf. We had a great time and the Larkspur Landing was nice to come back to at the end of the day.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice room, warm cookies!
review.locationRemarks: Near the San Francisco airport and easy access to downtown San Francisco by BART or freeway. Many good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Closer to San Francisco Civic center and Fishersman Wharf than i thougth. Clean and friendly staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The best part of it was the convinience of having the kitchen and the entrance to the freeway.
review.locationRemarks: There is a vietnamese restaurant around the area besides the few mexican restaurant a nice neighboorhood with a beautiful church worth stopping for

review.title: Close to the San Fran Giants stadium and airport
review.reviewText: Very nice room. Very comfortable beds. Nice TV. Kitchenette was available but we did not use. The only downfall was the smoke smell (maybe a guest smoking in the hallway) and the slow draining bathtub/ shower. Very good value.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was great for the type of room we received. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Better draining shower. Exhaust fans in the bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Close to the baseball diamond and downtown in general. Close to the airport too!

review.title: Under Rated
review.reviewText: My wife and I came to the Bay Area for our 1 year Anniversary lets just say the hotel staff was kind, polite and very attentive with us , everything we can ask for . Would recommend this hotel for anyone !! :)
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Protein for breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Minutes away from downtown San francisco

review.title: Used to always stay here - now not sure
review.reviewText:
It appears this hotel is under new management. They have taken away seating area for breakfast and there was only one table with 5 chairs, a small couch and 2 armchairs for the entire hotel to use for the free breakfast. People were everywhere trying to get their food. Coffee is removed from lobby immediately after breakfast. They used to have carafes in the lobby through out the day.

They now put a $25.00 "holding fee" on your credit card for each day of your stay. This is to cover any "incidentals" you may purchase. When I questioned this, they told me this had always been the policy. I disagree, as I have stayed there repeatedly & never had this done.

You must sign for a "light" cleaning from housekeeping. Clean towels are provided, but linens are now only changed a few times/week.

The desk chair in my room was ripped and torn. I have never seen a chair in this condition before. I was very surprised and dismayed.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel continues to be clean, staff are very helpful and polite. It is close to the airport and in a safe area. The towels were new & very fluffy
review.negativeRemarks: See above
review.locationRemarks: Close to SFO and has van service to airport.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText: Comfortably sized room (suite) for two adults and three kids.

review.title: Home away from home
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I live in San Jose, but wanted to find a place closer to SF because we were attending Outside Lands and didn't want to commute all three days. I looked for hotels on Expedia and chose Larkspur Landing partly due to it's location, partly because of the price. The hotel itself was fantastic, we used the gym and the spa the first night. There was only four workout machines, but it was fine for our short stay. There was no pool and the spa jets weren't working, but the spa seemed clean and was warm and relaxing. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful as well! Complete with coffee, cereal, bagels, fruit. Overall our stay here was comfortable and if the occasion ever rings again we will be back!
review.positiveRemarks: It was convenient, clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: It was kind of annoying that we had to take the stairs to get to the second floor but I suppose exercise does everyone good. The spa jets.
review.locationRemarks: Other hotels are nearby, but with a drive down Highway 1 is the Golden Gate Park

review.title: Very friendly and helpful staff
review.reviewText:
This hotel would be very suitable for those wishing to prepare their own meals as our room had a kitchen area equipped with a refrigerator, Microwave, plates cutlery etc.
Although there was a breakfast included the breakfast area in the lobby was a bit overcrowded with little space to sit. Most took their breakfast back to their room
review.positiveRemarks: Nicely furnished room with dining table and chairs and kitchen facilities
review.negativeRemarks: Crowded lobby area where breakfast was served
review.locationRemarks: Location close to SFO with free shuttle every 20 minutes

review.title: Nothing special
review.reviewText: This hotel was just OK. Nothing special about it except it is convenient to SFO. Upon arrival the front desk clerk was on the telephone and the entire time we were checking in she stayed on that phone call. Terrible customer service for the price we paid for one night. The room itself was clean but the kitchenette was completely useless for our stay. The bathroom is very poorly designed...the toilet and shower are on one side of the hallway and the sink on the other....very disjointed. I would not stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing!!!!

review.title: No luxury here,
review.reviewText: Looks great from the outside and inside, free parking and wifi, good luck parking here if you get back to your room at 10PM and the wifi is close to being useless it so slow we opted out using, got T_Mobile roaming card to use internet. In 3 occasion we got no water in the shower, standing under the shower soaped up and no water, the bedroom phone did not worked in the firs 3 days, and we could not receive incoming call most of the time, back to the cellphone.. Booked for 4 person and got 1 room with king size bed other was a terrible sofabed in the living room, asked the staff, I was booked for 2 full bed and not back up bed, they couldn't switch rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiete
review.negativeRemarks: Slow WiFi, No water, Bad sofa bed
review.locationRemarks: Quite, close to the freeway, not much around in walking distance.

review.title: Great location and friendly place to stay.
review.reviewText: We really liked the hotel. Overall ratings are high. However, we were not completely happy with the breakfast hours. As we were travelling for leisure we would have liked to have seen breakfast offered until 10:00. Also, there were not enough places to sit and eat. The common areas of the hotel were very warm.
review.positiveRemarks: l
review.negativeRemarks: See comments above.

review.title: Comfortable place to stay for 2 nights
review.reviewText: This was a comfortable place to stay for 2 nights. Staff was very helpful & pleasant. Bed very comfortable; rooms were clean. The bathroom door was a little crooked & didn't quite close cleanly, but that was the only thing we found wrong. It's in a quiet location surrounded by offices and other hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet, clean, comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the crooked sliding bathroom door that doesn't close quite all the way.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet area surrounded by offices & other large hotels. A Starbucks, 7-eleven and gas station are within approx 1 mile. Not a lot of action close by.

review.title: Good access to airport
review.reviewText: No issues, nothing special. . . bed would be very comfortable for one, but not so for two.
review.negativeRemarks: larger bet

review.title: Nice hotel like an apartment
review.reviewText: .Very pleased with our stay. Close to airport yet no airport noise. Continental breakfast well supplied. Bed comfortable. Hotel staff quickly responded to any of our needs or requests. Would highly recommend this suite hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: More seating area for continental breakfast room.

review.title: VERY NICE HOTEL CLOSE TO THE AIRPORT
review.reviewText: THE CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST WAS EXCELLENT. THE STAFF WAS VERY PROFESSIONAL AND WERE EAGER TO ASSIST.
review.positiveRemarks: HELP STAFF
review.negativeRemarks: THE FRIDGE WAS A LIL BIT NOISEY

review.title: Nice hotel near San Francisco airport
review.reviewText: Beautiful room with kitchenette. We arrived in the morning, and they held our luggage for us until check in time. The front desk clerk was very nice! Upon arrival later that night, there were fresh baked chocolate chip cookies :-) When we got to the room, the air conditioner wasn't working, so we called the desk. Within 5 minutes, there was someone to check on it! It seems someone had unplugged the unit...problem solved! Quiet hotel, nice snacks at desk (cookies at night, apples in morning) and free continental breakfast in morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfort, cleanliness, promptness of staff, and snacks that made you feel welcome.
review.locationRemarks: Only a few miles south of S.F. You can keep yourself busy for days!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good value being 10 minutes from downtown SF. Clean, comfortable, relaxing,
review.positiveRemarks: Decent price for the ammenities and location

review.title: Nice, clean and reasonable.
review.reviewText: I had a great time here!!! Clean and comfortable, they even offer free laundry you just have to bring or purchase your laundry detergent from the front desk. This is a great feature!!
review.positiveRemarks: Everything, very clean and the staff were very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!!!
review.locationRemarks: We were near the airport. They have a row of restaurants about 2 miles away which was very convenient. th

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great style for such an affordable price. Was surprised and pleased to discover the ceiling has inconspicuous mini lights so when you get up in the middle of the night you can see to get around, but they aren't so bright that you can't sleep. I'll definitely be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Tasteful decor
review.locationRemarks: Near so San Francisco

review.title: Last Minute Booking A Success
review.reviewText:
For my parents wedding anniversary, I originally had planned them a trip to Yosemite National Park. When plans fell through, they still wanted to go somewhere and decided upon San Francisco. I ended up finding Larkspur Landing in South San Francisco (about 20 mins to downtown San Francisco). My mother loved the location because it was in a nice quiet area away from the freeway leading into the city but not too far away from downtown San Francisco.

I stopped by, as I live in the area, and found the hotel to be up to date and on par with what they showed online. The front desk alway had a staff member at hand. The business center, which was across from the front desk, was spacious and provided amenities for those traveling on business.

What my parents loved most about the place was the hotel staff and their room. The hotel staff was courteous, professional, and knowledgable. They were able to provide information about restaurants, attractions, and nearby public transportation. The room was an executive mini suite, which including a fully functioning kitchen with a standard size fridge, dishwasher, and stove top, a queen sized bed, and a dining table

The only downside to this place was the view, which was of the parking lot.

If you want to experience a nice getaway to San Francisco without having to deal with San Francisco traffic or high price hotels, then definitely check out Larkspur Landing in South San Francisco.

review.title: Wonderful 3 nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: On April 25 - 28, my husband and I were supporting our kids who had 2 competitions in San Francisco and Sacramento. Our kids were staying at a hotel in Union Square area with their schoolmates where the competition was being held. We decided to stay not too close with them and we found Larkspur Landing South San Francisco was a perfect place for us for that trip. We're staying at the executive suit room that provided us with little kitchen, refrigerator, coffee maker, dishwasher, microwave, etc. The room is also furnished with 2 flat screen televisions, one in the bedroom and the other in the living room. My husband had a chance to do his work because they have free internet and office desk in the living room. We love the free parking and breakfast! The driving to downtown and surrounding areas was very easy! The staff are friendly and very helpful! Yes, we recommend this hotel to you who want to get away for weekend, holiday or even for business trip.

review.title: Worst treatment in 30 years of business travel!
review.reviewText:
Image a 54 year old female executive forced to enter her rental car by climbing into the rear passenger seat while on her way to catch a flight and you can imagine my impression of Larkspur Landing. Another car forced their way next to my car completely blocking any entry from the driver's side. So into the back seat I went and over the seats to be able to drive the car. There was parking lot obstruction to entering in the passenger front seat.

Yes, I did go to the front desk first. Larkspur Landings' response to my request for help? "We don't park the cars."

I suggest maybe towing the offending vehicle and all the front desk rep did was to start clicking on her computer. I gave up after telling her this was completely ridiculous. Perhaps a staff member about 30 years younger could have made the climb but that wasn't offered.

I am forever thankful I decided to fly in casual clothes because climbing over the seat in a skirt and heels would have been truly ridiculous. There were so many ways they could have at least seemed like they cared about me - their guest. But nothing was forthcoming so over the seats I climbed never to stay at this hotel again!

review.title: The staff left me in the cold - literally
review.reviewText:
Service here is abysmal.

I stayed at Larkspur Landing for a week while attending a conference in San Francisco. I picked this hotel for its proximity to the Caltrain station.

At night I would ride the train from SF to the South San Francisco stop. I always called Larkspur Landing in advance and asked them to send their courtesy shuttle out to pick me up at the train (about a mile away.)

For two nights this worked well. On my last night I called them at 6:55pm... and 7:10... and 7:25... and 7:40. Each time I called the young lady who answered the phone told me "we'll be there soon."

I stood outside at the train station as the sun set and the temperature dropped.

Larkspur Landing *never* picked me up. Eventually I just caught a cab back to the hotel.

I would have been perfectly happy on my first call the front desk had told me "I'm sorry, but the shuttle is backed-up right now... here's the phone number for a local cab service we use." A little bit of transparency and helpfulness goes a long way. Sadly, I got none of that.

That evening I emailed the general manager and the director of operations for this property. I also email the president and the chairman/ceo of the Larkspur Landing company. None of them responded to my email.

Yes, this hotel is affordable and not too far from San Francisco. Those are its only positive features.

The service here is terrible and it's backed-up by a completely apathetic management team.

review.negativeRemarks: Waiting for an hour for a courtesy shuttle that never showed up

review.reviewText: No complaint. It was a good stay. Next time when I'm in town again will stay for sure if I can get for the great price I did.

review.title: Room itself was very good.
review.reviewText:
Room: clean and wide.
Location: close to the airport.
Service: complimentary breakfast and free wifi were good.

review.title: great hotel for family
review.reviewText:
breakfast room was not big enough. only few people can have breakfast. they open the meeting room for breakfast but when we have stayed it was weekend and meeting room was closed. so we had breakfast in our room.
hotel was far to downtown and popular places you want to see but there was shuttle bus to take you there. we didnt use shuttle bus and driven everyday to downtown. but parking fees in city was too much. i have paid 28 usd for 8 hours staying. so i recommend you to take shuttle.
room was big enough, hotel was in good condition. hotel staff was so helpful and so kind always. suit room was not sufficient to stay for the families who has one than more child(if they are teenager)
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: easy acces from highway
review.locationRemarks: closed to highway but far to downtown

review.title: One night close to the airport.
review.reviewText: We just needed a hotel close to the airport. The shuttle service worked great.
review.positiveRemarks: Shuttle.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport.

review.title: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed here for our first trip to the west coast. From the moment we checked in the staff was more than helpful. When we had an issue with our luggage with the airport, they helped us out as much as they could. The free breakfast was great and the free cookies were delicious. The staff was very friendly. The area was good also. There was a lot of shops and restaurants close by and the drive to downtown San Francisco wasn't bad either. It definitely beats paying for an expensive hotel and paying for parking. Free parking, free breakfast, free wifi. I would defiantly stay here again. We stayed for 9 nights and found this to be a great value!
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast daily
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: surrounded by other hotels, near SFO

review.title: Excellent for the Price
review.reviewText:
Our stay at the hotel was fantastic. The rooms were clean, the staff was very helpful, and the location was perfect. We went over Labor Day weekend to explore San Francisco and I just couldn't justify spending $300+ on hotels downtown. Larkspur Landing is about 15 minutes from downtown on the 101 and about 4 minutes to the airport. It might not have all the bells and whistles of a more expensive 5-star hotel, but for the price and proximity to everything, it can't be beat.

The only negative aspects that we could see were the view out the window and meager breakfasts, but again, I'm splitting hairs. The hotel has planted trees outside of the windows to try to hide the industrial park it abuts, and the continental breakfast was a bit limited, but complimentary. Realistically, I knew they had to cut corners SOMEWHERE to allow us to pay so little for the room, and I'm glad they don't skimp on cleanliness. I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: PRICE, location, cleanliness, parking
review.negativeRemarks: The view from the room, breakfast

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Compare to the price, this hotel is super luxurious!
Room is very quiet, clean, organized and no smoking smell whatsoever. Kitchen is very nice; it has everything except knifes and folks.
Staff is very courteous that a front desk called me at night to ask if everything is ok. Nothing much but feel grateful.

Breakfast is awesome too!

Anything like this hotel so far. In the future, I will use this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Little far from SF downtown but if you have a car and take freeway, it is all good.

review.title: Extra Friendly Staff-Great Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: For the price, this was one of the nicest hotels rooms we have stayed at. The staff was exceptional...from the front desk to the cleaning staff. We felt appreciated by all. I was impressed by the wide assortment of goodies available at the continental breakfast as well as the the fresh cookies baked in the afternoon. The ice cold lemon water was a nice touch in the lobby, and it was surprising to see a long list of current movies available to check out that you can watch in your room on the DVD player for free. Better than pay per view, if you ask me. Overall, we were pleasently surprised by Larkspur Landing and we would definitley stay at this chain again, in any city.
review.positiveRemarks: Kitchenette in the room
review.negativeRemarks: room was not ready at the check in time (holiday weekend)
review.locationRemarks: close to the airport...for better or worse

review.title: Good location... That's about it though...
review.reviewText: Location is great and beds are comfortable but staff seemed frustrated to help with any matters. The breakfast (what don't run out by 8) is not much and when asking for anything that that's gone..... Well, good luck.... Our room in particular was really loud and again over all was pretty disappointed.

review.title: The best hotel from 3 in our trip
review.reviewText: Nice hotel,clean beautiful furniture nice tv.with satellite very clean,overall first class.my wife and i are very satisfied with this hotel.Five stars
review.positiveRemarks: Everithing

review.title: Convenient for the airport and very comfortable
review.reviewText:
The room and hotel were of a good standard. The only downside was the quality of the breakfast which was very poor. With still one hour left of the breakfast time, there was no tea or hot water available. Also where it is situated makes it very difficult when it is busy. The food and fruit ran out very quickly and I'd not seem to get replenished very quickly.
Also, there is poor soundproofing between the floors and I was awakened by the people walking about in the room above.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast

review.title: Great for a family!
review.reviewText: This was the perfect setting for us as we were traveling with a small child. Having the additional room helped to give her the space she needed to sleep well and to explore. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: godd stay for family outside of SF downtown
review.reviewText:
We liked this hotel very much even though it is outside of San Francisco. We extended our stay there instead of moving downtown, even though the parking in SF is not easy.

Staff is very responsive and pleasant.

Good stay for family.

Breakfast is limited, but still very much acceptable.
review.positiveRemarks: Very calm hotel with good comfort for parents in separate room
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning of the room is sometimes done late afternoon, and when you have small kids and come back around 4pm, the room is sometimes not done.

review.title: San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: Our stay was short but very nice. Convenient to San Fran International Airport. Room was great & extrememly quiet.

review.title: Overall Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Only 2 negative comments: 1. our shower tub drained slowly, it needed to be cleaned out. 2. morning front desk personnel was busy on the phone, so we waited 10 minutes, before she would help us out with our question. It seems like more front desk help was needed in the AM.

review.title: It was okay

review.title: Great for Family stay!

We especially liked the suite since we wanted to stay together.
review.positiveRemarks: Suite set up was very spacious and breakfast was generous. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful.Easy shuttle service to SF and airport.

Nice continental breakfast and overall a very nice place to stay.

Super convenient to get back and forth to the city and other surrounding areas.

review.title: Great rooms

review.reviewText: With separate living, kitchen and bed rooms, it is like a home away from home. It is such an improvement over the one room bed and a chair situation.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean and staff was nice. Only wish the breakfast began a little earlier that 7am. Close to the highway and about 10-15min from downtown San Fran. Would have been good for my family had they come. Had fridge, sink, and kitchenware. No restaurants within walking distance, but some local places a short drive away.

review.title: Very good Hotel

review.title: Great stay.
review.reviewText: Great pet friendly hotel close to the city. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

review.title: Underwhelming but acceptable
review.reviewText: Our check in experience close to midnight was wonderful -- the young man at the front desk was personable and efficient. Unfortunately it went downhill from there. The rest of the staff wasn't terrible -- just not very prompt or helpful. They need to be better organized. Also, the hotel shuttle was not available after 2 PM on the weekends, although it apparently is available until 9 PM on weekdays. Since the hotel isn't near anything, you definitely need a car or expect to take expensive taxis to do anything. Their cold breakfast buffet wasn't great, and there was very little room to sit and eat.

review.title: Great stay for the business person

review.title: Great room...Need better Breakfast
review.reviewText: Great price for great room....even though the room does have a full kitchen...it would be nice to have a better continental breakfast included.

review.title: Above Standard
review.reviewText: The hotel is nicely located in a quiet area between SF and SFO. The suits and amenity are above standard and the hotel staff are responsive. Most services such as breakfast, laundry, internet and parking are free.

review.title: Cozy and Comfy!
review.reviewText:
A very cozy and comfy room with great staff and close to SFO.

My only complaint was the noise the fridge made. It was quite noticeable at night so I recommend turning the fridge off or bringing a pair of ear plugs if you are bothered by it.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Room was nice. Great free breakfast. Comfortable bed. Used the exercise room and spa. 10 miles from downtown to get free parking and quiet.

review.title: Excellent hotel.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel at a reasonable price. Booked a 1 Bedroom King Suite and were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. It felt more like an apartment rather than a hotel room. Fully equipped kitchen, nice livingroom area and seperate bedroom with a very comfortable bed. Bathroom had 2 sinks which is always a plus. Definitely would stay here again.

review.title: Awesome Place!!
review.reviewText: Awesome room, will stay there everytime I visit San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Feather beds

review.title: Great hotel in south san francisco w/free parking
review.reviewText:
When we arrived at the hotel to check in apparently my reservation was just for one day but since I printed out my confirmation which stated 3 days not 1 the service desk gentleman fixed the problem right then and then. Problem fixed. Very pleasant check-in.

Our stay at the hotel was very comfortable, our room came with a full kitchen, separate bedroom and and living room. Seemed like we were at home with all the amenities one needs to feel at home.

Rooms were made everyday and upon our return to the room, our room was cleaned and beds were made which is something we really enjoyed since other hotels simply take for ever to do.

I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit the bay area. A plus is, the hotel is does not charge for parking something other hotels do.

review.title: Comfortable suite to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great place to stay in general. But I rate 4.0, not 5.0, because of the housekeeping service. On the first day, they didn't clean our room well, and the carpet was obviously not vacuumed. We have 2 toddlers, and it's easy to have mess around the room. When we came back from the 1st day sightseeing, it was a little disappointing to see that our room wasn't clean as I expected....All other services were great, and it was a comfortable suite to stay. We prepared an easy meal, using the kitchen, and it was also very nice to have 2 TVs, one in the living room, and the other in the bed room.

review.title: lots of room
