review.reviewText: Customer service with a smile. hotel was clean, peaceful and staff was very friendly. Mattresses and bedding were so comfy.

review.title: Immaculate Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great continental Breakfast good seating.
About $45 cab ride to town (BART much cheaper if time not precious)

review.title: Total comfort
review.reviewText: Stayed at many hotels around the San Francisco Airport area. Larkspur Landing South San Francisco was by far the best. Clean and comfortable, great staff, shuttle bus to and from the Pier. Great.

review.title: Pleasant, less-expensive alternative to the city center
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I went up to SF for the Hardly Strictly Bluegrass festival and stayed at the Larkspur Landing because we didn't want to spend $500 or more for two nights at a hotel we'd barely be in. I looked all over the city center and when I couldn't find anything for a reasonable price, I started looking by the airport. We saved over $200 staying in South SF, and while it doesn't have the atmosphere of being someplace like Nob Hill or Union Square, it was still convenient to our plans in the city.

The hotel itself was perfectly nice. Plenty of parking, easy and friendly check-in, nicely decorated. We had a studio suite, which was a bit smaller than I expected it to be, but still totally fine. The full kitchen was nice to have as was the extra seating. The place is very nicely decorated - you can tell that they're making an effort to make it a nice, and it's pretty successful. I could still see the more economy hotel bones of the building, but they've done a good job of sprucing it up. My only issue with the hotel is that I requested a queen and we ended up with a double bed. It was still fine (and comfortable), but if I'd known that could happen, I would have reconfirmed at check-in.

Over all, it was a perfectly pleasant place to stay. Nothing super amazing, but clean, nice, comfortable and easy. And affordable! I wouldn't recommend it if you didn't have a car though.

review.title: Cheap stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Quality of hotel service - good quick service, requires a little better people attention.

Condition or maintenance of the hotel - good condition

Cleanliness of your room - clean rooms with lots of space

Comfort of room - very comfortable beds

Convenience of hotel location - not to bad if you have a car and don't mind spending about $3.50 hr parking in San Francisco. Very good for airport. Close to large shopping mall.

Surrounding neighborhood - business park close to South San Francisco shops.

Overall Satisfaction with the hotel - works well for our road trip budget

review.title: Better than Expected!
review.reviewText: We came up to SF to see a Giants Baseball game at AT&T Park. The hotel was just minutes away and SO convenient and easy to find RIGHT off the freeway, YET far enough away to be very peaceful and quiet. We stayed in a suite with a kitchen. The bathroom was VERY nice, VERY clean. The bed was luxurious and felt like Heaven. The room was nice and warm and inviting when we arrived. We were favorably impressed and feel we got quite a deal through Expedia.

review.title: Almost Perfect
review.reviewText: Everything you would possibly need was provided by the hotel. It was very clean and quiet. The only drawback is that they advertise "premium bedding", The bed was not that comfortable although I was able to sleep well- it sagged in the middle. The "premium bedding" is what swayed me to stay there.

review.title: Excellen hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Had a great experience. Conveniently located.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Well designed room - very comfortable bed and friendly staff.

review.title: If you want a hotel for an early AM flight
review.reviewText: The hotel is relatively close to a gas station (to fill up rental car) and the airport. No noise from the airport. A small breakfast but yoghurt and cereal filled me up. Plenty of parking and excellent directions from staff. Nice rooms too. A place we will stay again if we fly out from SFO in the morning.

review.title: larkspur landing is great
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome!!!! Very friendly and clean, they even had a free shuttle to union square!!!

review.title: Satisfied Customer
review.reviewText:
I was very pleased with the Larkspur. The studio room was small but well laid out and comfortable. The Hotel is conveniently located near an on-ramp to US 101 with downtown San Francisco just 15 minutes away. Parking is free.
Good place to stay.

review.title: Love the hotel chain
review.reviewText: Larkspur has always been a good experience. The staff is always friendly and the rooms are always nice. The continental breakfast is always fresh and the kids love the cookies in the afternoon.

review.title: The hotel was the best part of the trip!
review.reviewText: The room was perfect. Cozy, clean and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in a hotel. Came with a fully equipped kitchen, including a full size refrigerator and a small dishwasher. At any time during the day or night you can go to the front desk for fresh homemade cookies or you can have fruit. The breakfast bar was very nice. Nothing hot like scrambled eggs or waffles, but they did have hard boiled eggs, so that you did get some protein in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you are there on business. It is perfectly suited for that. You get free wifi and a free business center where you can even print for free!

review.title: great job Larkspur Landing
review.reviewText: Larkspur Landing was exactly what we needed. A hotel with a kitchen, a parking lot, a friendly staff and less than 30 minutes to San Francisco.

review.title: our favorite
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the Larkspur many times. Friendly staff. Very practical layout in both rooms and suites. The breakfast and the location (close to cute downtown South San Francisco) suit our needs perfectly.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: clean, convenient

review.title: Comfortable Lodging
review.reviewText: This was a comfortable place to spend an evening while flying out of the nearby airport. Shuttle was convenient; room was spacious and beds were comfortable.

review.title: Use it for Business
review.reviewText: I use the hotel for business travel 1-2 times per month. It is always clean and the staff is friendly.

review.title: We always stay at Larkspur Landing when we are at San Francisco.
review.reviewText: It's a beautiful place, comfy and restful.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: The hallway has a stale odor, not to mention the smell of marijuana along the 3rd flr during early morning. The service is satisfactory but the it would have been a better stay if they serve hot breakfast meals.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: My nephews (14 and 12 years old) hugged me when we got there and thanked me for getting this hotel. The room was a suite, and they had a queen sized bed to share, while their father had a fold out couch in the other room. There was a kitchenette where they could make snacks and the staff got them bagels to toast in the morning as they had a very early flight. We ordered pizza from a local restaurant that came like room service, and they loved the big flat screen tvs in both rooms. There was a little balcony off the bedroom that was so much fun. There was also a fitnesscenter, and in the lobby a fire and very friendly staff. I chose it because it was inexpensive and near the airport, but they thought I got it just to please them.

review.title: Will go back!
review.reviewText:
Although close to airport this hotel is pretty quiet. Rooms are clean and comfotable, little kitchen has all the basics that are needed.
Travel time to downtown less than 20 min.
On the other side of the highway (N on Grand Bulevard) numerous italian, chinese, indian and thai restaurants - very convenenient.

review.title: The best
review.reviewText: This is a very nice place to stay. I asked the desk person if he could recommend a restaurant and not only did he inform me of a great Italian place he asked me what time I would like to go so he could have a driver (free) take me. No driving = extra glass of wine. Great room, Very nice with lots of extras right down to a DVD player in the room. I would not stay anywhere but Larkspur when I need a place in S. San Francisco

review.title: Interesting hotel
review.reviewText: The Larkspur Landing near SFO is great if you are in San Francisco for a brief business trip. The proximity and complimentary shuttle to and from the airport are great perks. It also helped with gaining access to the BART from SFO. I stayed for two nights. The first night - not so great. My room was on a lower floor, near the exit, and right above the trash collection area. The Internet did not work nor did the television in the bedroom or the living room. Changed to a different room the second evening which was great. They offer a pretty decent complimentary breakfast and the hotel staff were more than accommodating in addressing my first night concerns. If I was on a limited budget, I would stay here again....otherwise downtown in Union Square would be my preference.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We needed a transition hotel between our stay in the city with friends and leaving to go home and this hotel was a good choice. The staff were helpful and pleasant.

review.title: Quiet Location
review.reviewText: Our booking was in the area north of SFO airport and east of the freeway into SF. The location is far enough from either so as not to notice; very quiet neighborhood for being near a major international airport. No planes overhead or a few blocks away as with other properties in the area. Not an issue with booking again in the future. Our weekend commute into downtown was 10-15 minutes.

review.title: Great and Affordable Hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was clean and with added small kitchen, it was a perfect room for a vacation. Bed was really comfortable.

Cons: internet speed really slow (especially if your room is far away from access point). I used the ethernet cable and it was still very slow (i.e. dial-up speed). Temperature controller was not intuitive (it was hot periodically at night). It was quickly addressed by the hotel management.

Pros: The hotel service was great and breakfast was better than I expected. They had juice in cans, which were helpful for us when we were travelling around bay area. Free parking was GOOD! 15 minutes away from downtown.

review.title: Very pleased with Larkspur Landing
review.reviewText: We were able to find the Larkspur Landing quite easily. We commuted to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 for dinner Friday night. We went to the King Tut Exhibit at the De Young Museum on Saturday. We got breakfast at the hotel and were there in plenty of time. We enjoyed visiting in their lounging area at the end of the day. There was plenty of sitting room for all 10 of us. The price was right and we enjoyed our stay. We would go back to the Larkspur Landing in South San Francisco.

review.title: Nice place, good food and very comfortable
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay and short distance to downtown San Francisco. Very comfortable bed and pillows. The large double sink bathroom was great. Breakfast was really healthy and good. It would have been nice if the asian girl at the front desk could had a more pleasant demeanor.

review.title: Not Clean
review.reviewText: =( Very unhappy with overall experience!!!

review.title: I will use Larkspur Landing Hotels everywhere I go
review.reviewText: The Hotel was conventiently located, the staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Super value
review.reviewText: Stayed here twice in ten day trip. This hotel was an excellent value for a classy hotel. I can't fault this place in any category. The shuttle service to San Francisco International Airport was very convenient.

review.title: Great value just outside San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed for a month and were comfortable the whole time, due to the many amenities. Continental breakfast, kitchen in room, free parking, and on-site laundry were real pluses. We could bring our pet with us too. The staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Home away from home!
review.reviewText: I felt this location was excellent, close to the airport and about 11 miles from SF city. Easy access to the freeway and lots of eating places on Grand Ave. The laundry facility was awesome being that you can do your own laundry for free. It's a full kitchen so easy to stock it with beverages, snacks or leftovers. Fresh baked cookies in the afternoon was a nice touch. I would recommend it to anyone, business traveler, families, or vacationers!

review.title: Larkspur Landing....South San Francisco's Gem
review.reviewText: Upon driving up to the Larkspur Landing hotel I must admit I wasn't impressed with the location. There was no view in the front, back or side of the hotel. I guess that was expected considering it was an airport hotel. BUT when I entered the lobby, I was greeted by one of the most professional front desk attendants I've ever encountered (Mike). He made me feel right at home. Check in was easy and quick and before I knew it I was in my room. The room was clean, quaint, and very comfortable. The air condition was already on for me, which was a nice touch. There was also a full kitchen with the works. The bathroom was amazing, and the complimentary toiletries smelled great. The living space was most comfortable and the huge flat screen TV was an added bonus. Breakfast is complimentary and it superceded anything I've ever had in a US hotel. With the great rooms and awesome complimentary breakfast, I would definitely stay again, just not in room 231. I was annoyed by the noise that came from the room above. I'm not sure if there were hardwood floors in the room, or if the person had heavy feet, but he/she sounded as if they were stomping when walking. Luckily they turned in early every night, but boy was it loud. Overall, this hotel was a great find and I will definitely stay again. Thanks Larkspur Landing.

review.title: Will Stay Again!
review.reviewText: Great rooms, comfy bed, big screen TV, very quiet...what more can you ask?

review.title: Wonderful Place to Stay!
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the staff person who checked me in. Staff was courteous and accomodating. The room was clean and well maintained and had nice ammenities such as "free" internet, and the free parking was also a plus. In checking out the next day, staff was also very polite, no hassles. My wife and I had a "really" wonderful night. We would definetly stay again.

review.title: Great way to end a vacation
review.reviewText: We spent a week in Central California and ended our vacation in San Francisco. We chose Larkspur Landing for the rate and its location to SFO. We flew out at 6:15 the next morning and had the convenience of using the hotel's shuttle service, at 4:00am! The room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. I will defintely recommend them to anyone who asks and will use them again!

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: very nice and clean.

review.title: One of the best hotels
review.reviewText: 1) The service in the reception was very good 2) The shuttle service is very convenient 3) the room and bed ere like 5* hotel

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Larkspur Landing San Francisco Airport is an excellent value suites hotel near by the SFO. Hotel has spacious, clean and well maintained suites with full kitchen. Fast Wireless Internet service is included, business center has working well maintained equipment and continental breakfast is good. I have stayed in this suites hotel now couple of times and can warmly recommend it.

review.title: We Like This Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is a place where we always try to stay when we visit the bay area. It's close to the airport, but not too close, and right down the street from the rental car center. Parking is free, unlike hotels in the city, and the savings are significant. Our room always has a full kitchen but what we use mostly is the refrigerator. The furnishings are very decent. There is a good work desk. The queen size bed is comfortable and the linens are good quality and clean. The pillows are well shaped. There is free internet access, plus there is a small business center with computers providing free internet use. Downtown San Francisco is only about 10 miles away and takes only a few minutes to reach on Hwy 101 which is less than a mile from the hotel. Within a few minutes of the hotel are good restaurants, though the hotel does not provide a restaurant. There is a free continental breakfast typical of mid-range hotels. We recommend Larkspur Landing to everyone.

review.title: The Sleeper Hotel Chain
review.reviewText: I have stayed at quite a few hotel chains in the San Francisco area, but this was by far the best for the price range.The hotel was eye appealing and very clean (A MUST!)and the staff was very friendly. I stayed in a regular suite which had a queen bed, full kitchen and flat LCD T.V. I have never found a room with a full kitchen or these ammenities in this price range. I will definatly be saying here in the future and would highly reccomend it.

review.title: NIce place to stay.
review.reviewText: We chose this location, because it was much less expensive than locations in downtown SanFrancisco. Parking is free, a nice breakfast is included, the suite was very nice, it is accessible to the freeways and is close to the airport. We enjoyed the full kitchen and separate living room. The staff was very friendly.

review.title: Great hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, the only small issue was the smoke in the hallways near the non-smoking rooms, but the room itself was smoke free. The staff was friendly and most helpful, and when I mentioned something about extended parking while I was away, it was a big help, I would return.

review.title: convenient airport hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here to avoid an early morning drive to the San Francisco airport. The suite was comfortable and surprisingly well-equipped - like a home away from home. Afternoon cookie service novel and continental breakfast were more than what is expected of a standard continental breakfast.

review.title: The best hotel where we stayed in America
review.reviewText: It is pity that this hotel chain is only on the west coast in America. Should we return to the west cost for vacation, we will choose this hotel again. The service from the hotel, particularly the reception, was perfect. The rooms were very comfortable and cleanly. You have in this hotel a lot of services, for example that they buy for you groceries. The hotel have a barbeque grill.

review.title: Will keep in mind whenever I'm in Frisco
review.reviewText: I was impressed at the hotel's satisfaction rating before reserving rooms at this place. The room was so comfortable, can't complain. The only issue I had was the wireless internet service but no biggie, and my last night, the people from the room above me had "heavy feet" but these were all minor stuff. I will definitely come back to this hotel, maybe request a room on the topmost floor.

review.title: Larkspur Landing San Francisco Airport: Great deal, great location, great price!!
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel was fantastic. Its location was just 2 minutes off the freeway in a nice, quiet little business district. Upon entering the lobby we were greeted by a warm and friendly desk manager. The room was spacious, comfortable, and quiet. Our sleep was uninterrupted by airplanes (you cannot hear them inside or outside this hotel, at all), the bed was extremely comfy, and the room amenities such as the shower, kitchen, etc. were all in great condition, creating an atmosphere of luxury. For the price (much cheaper than the Larkspur in San Francisco proper) this hotel CANNOT, I repeat CANNOT be beat. It was simply amazing. I will undoubtedly stay here any time I am in San Francisco or the airport area.

review.title: Great place to stay for the price. Will use again
review.reviewText: Do not judge Hotel on location. Once you are inside, the rooms and service make up for location.

review.title: Better than expected!
review.reviewText: The day before, I made sure that my room was confirmed - I had a live person pick up the phone! I was truly impressed! My flight arrived at 10:30PM from SFO Int'l. Shuttles come every 20 minutes from the airport until midnight. To confirm this, I called the hotel and I was greeted by another live person (no waiting)! After the short shuttle ride, the check-in process was very quick and the clerk provided me with cookies since there were no restaurants nearby. The room was more than comfortable and very large. It had a full kitchen and a large bathroom. Free parking and internet was a plus, with the business center and its free printing was more than handy! Free continental breakfast was great, too!

review.title: Enjoyed this hotel .
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel for a business traveler. The room had all the amenities. Free high speed internet access,very comfortable feather bed, pillow menus,small kitchenette, good breakfast,and fresh-baked cookies in the evening.

review.title: Great Extended-Stay Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Extended-Stay hotel: Small Kitchen set-up, large table for use as work desk and/or dining area and great bath products. 24-hour complimentary coffee, as well as cookies and fruit are standard amenities, too. Close proximity to SFO and local businesses and restaurants.

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the feather pillows and bath towels seemed as if they were just brand new. Will definetly stay again.

review.title: Larkspur
review.reviewText: This is a convenient hotel near to the airport - its not plush but the rooms are a very reasonable size and comfortable. Reviews have said that the breakfast is excellent - I would not go as far as that but it is adequate - although most take it back to their rooms as there is not really adequate facilities to eat in the breakfast room. A safe area to park your car.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Executive Suite was excellent for our party of 5 people including two little children. The complimentary breakfast was the perfect start to the day- Coffee,Bagels,Fresh Fruit, String Cheese, Yogurt, Hard Boiled Eggs, Juices,Instant Oatmeal. Above all- the staff were extremely courteous and professional.

review.title: Terrific deal at The Larkspur Landing SF Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: The Larkspur Landing SF Airport Hotel offers you a terrific deal: free broadband WiFi Internet access, free parking and easy access to the 101 Freeway towards San Francisco to the north, SFO and The Peninsula to the south. Each hotel room has a full kitchen, (fridge, range, microwave, sink, dishwasher), as well as true Californian amenities such as Eucalyptus, Thyme and Mint essential oils in your bath soaps and shampoos. Try their healthy, continental breakfast to start your day, grocery shopping service, and fresh baked cookies for your afternoon nap. The hotel also has a free business center with fax, printer and several stand alone computers. Hazel and Christine are the best Filipino concierge staff!

review.title: Excellent hotel with great staff
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for 1 week and would say that the quality and service were excellent. The hotel is located 3 miles from the SFO airport so it's convenient. Breakfast has decent variety and choices. I noticed that there is a free shuttle from the airport however I rented a car. There is a great park 1 mile away Oyster Point, with parking and beautiful view of SF bay and airport from far away. I even saw a seal while jogging there. The location is in a "corporate park" setting, Unisys, Amgen, Elan business headquarter buildings within vicinity. However grocery stores, restaurants, and obviuosly beatiful downtown SF are not within a walking distance, so to enjoy the seclusion of this hotel but having quick access onto highway, I recommend renting a car. Excellent service for a moderate price.

review.title: Good suite hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed at several of these. The rooms are nice, the kitchen is a good feature for longer trips. The staff is always very helpful.

review.title: Surprisingly good
review.reviewText: Never heard of this hotel chain before. I travel about 80% of the time. and it compair very favourably against other national chain hotels DVD player in the room (note hotel offers DVDs but all about 3 or 4 years old) cant have it competeing with pay per view

review.title: Very Comfortable and Great Room Service
review.reviewText: The hotel was very comfortable and the staff was very courteous. The breakfast was healthy and the hotel was very clean.

review.title: A great hotel for the price you pay
review.reviewText: This was probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The beds were comfortable and the room ammenities were great! If we travel back to San Francisco we will definately stay here.

review.title: Very Impressed and Satisfied
review.reviewText: Larkspur Landing Hotel did all they could do to make our stay pleasant. When we return to SF, we will certainly look at Larkspur again.

review.title: Larkspur Landing
review.reviewText: Me and my family stayed there and loved it! If were ever back in that area we will definatly be staying there. The rooms were clean and nice and the staff was awesome! 100% recomend it!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice.

review.title: Cozy
review.reviewText: Such a great hotel for an amazing price! The rooms were very nice, kitchen fully equipped with dishwasher and all! The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows were heavenly! I enjoyed my stay and would definitely return.

review.title: stay here when you're in the bay area
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Pet friendly place. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good for an airport hotel
review.reviewText: Good for cleanliness, no excess charges, friendly staff. Spa and workout room both very nice. Bed very comfortable. Just wish there were more dining options.

review.title: Great place, great staff, good value
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel after staying in central SF which we needed to get out of as it was not very nice. This place is fantastic - excellent rooms, great friendly and helpful staff, ideal for the airport (2.2 miles) and only 13 miles to SF on the freeway. 20 min walk to local marina (Oyster point). Highly recommended and extremely good value. Free parking. Local shops and dinning etc nearby. Hotel will do your shopping for you at no charge.

review.title: Very comfortable but....
review.reviewText: I've mixed feeling about this Hotel. 1) The staff could be more friendly, not chewing gum teenager. 2) For the cost that I paid for the room, should have included a carafe to boil water for making tea. 3) The bed, a word "WOW" best night rest that I have had. 4) Continental breakfast? I had expected the work but all there was one room with few chairs, one table and no much breakfast. 5) Fantastic Shuttle service, almost a Taxi on demand without the cost. I only stayed half a day and one night, but I will give the Tumb up for a longer stays, Ron

review.title: Very Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because of concerts I had to play at CSUSF. Its location provided easy access to the campus without the traffic craziness I would have experienced had I booked a hotel in town. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The bed was exceptionally nice. The staff was pleasant and very helpful, with one exception. I think she is not yet clear on how far a smile could get her even if the resolution of the problem is out of her hands. But she was truly the exception.

review.title: nice but a little bit small
review.reviewText: this hotel is nice,but just felt the room is a little bit small.they just have 5 room with king bed.if you dont care the room space,it should be a good choice.

review.title: Great Value for the Money-
review.reviewText: I fantastic hotel and is my choice when I have to stay in the area. Beds are very comfortable and are staged with 5 pillows. Free breakfast is a continental, but there is a full buffet at the sister "full service" hotel across the parking lot. The suites have a full kitchens that are stocked with silverware, plates, cups, and cooking pots and pans. Love having a decent sized refrigerator. Location is industrial so not too much around, however it's close to the highway with a Starbucks down the street.

review.title: Comfortable and Cozy
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to the airport and the city (about 10 minutes). It is very comfortable and cozy. The hotel provides you with very lush, soft and thick blankets and pillows. It also provides free Starbucks coffee, fruit and cookies in the "living room" 24 hours a day. I also used the 24 hour business center which provides free internet (in the room, too) and color printing. The hotel also offers free DVD checkouts from a selection of good and recently released movies. The only negative I would have to include is the fact that they do not have a restaurant and that quick bites aren't easy to find. But overall, I would stay at this hotel chain again and recommend it to friends.

review.title: will be happy to return
review.reviewText: We were extremely pleased with the quality and service of the hotel. We took advantage of the free amenities such as the DVD library, freshly baked peanut butter cookies, and Starbuck's coffee in our hotel suite. The location of the hotel to the city was a short drive and we look forward to staying here on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Definitely would stay here again.
review.reviewText: This is a very clean, quiet hotel. Access was easy, and the continental breakfast was better than most.

review.title: Very clean and maintained hotel
review.reviewText: Location was good and staff was friendly!

review.title: A little bit of a disappointment............
review.reviewText: Despite telling them this was the last night of our honeymoon they gave us a room overlooking a car park and the bed sheets had what looked like makeup stains on them. The folks at the front desk were friendly enough but were never exactly in a hurry to serve you. The "healthy start" breakfast was also somewhat disappointing - stick a bagel and a plastic pot of oatmeal on a plastic plate and take it too your room. This hotel was lacking something!!

review.title: Great Hotel But
review.reviewText: I found this hotel a very enjoyable experince except for the maid service. Not sure if it was due to a short staff or that they took to many breaks. What ever it was I was gone from the room from 1:00 pm to 6:00 and to my surprise the room wasn't cleaned. Needless to say I did not leave a tip for the maid. Everything else was very well done.

review.title: A nice stay close to the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and the complimentary breakfast in the morning was nice. The complimentary shuttle is nice, but stops at midnight, so if you plan on going into the city and staying up late, I'd recommend getting a cab. Or, you could take BART back to the airport, but don't count on many cabs coming by if it's very late.

review.title: great getaway spot
review.reviewText: This was a cozy and very comfortable hotel for the price you pay.It was away from everything but the shuttle bus took us to the airport ,then you could catch the bart to anywhere else.The shuttle service was free.They had complimentary cookies and fresh coffee every evening.The continental breakfast was great.They offer free shuttle to the grocery store which was excellent. The staff was great,and we highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Needs Improvement...
review.reviewText: This hotel is clean, comfortable, and a great value. However, during both of my stays there, I encountered horrible customer service and numerous technical problems. My first stay, I got a room with no working TV for five nights (no compensation offered, no replacement issued, no room change possible as the hotel was fully booked) and the staff refused to refund my room rate so I could go to another hotel. During my second stay, the internet was down in all of the hotel rooms for three days, again with no apologies or compensation from the staff. Aside from poor customer service, rude staff, and technical problems, this hotel would be wonderful.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: I have stayed for 4 great nights very easy to get to the city,and close to the rental car return at the airport.

review.title: We would go there again.
review.reviewText: The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Nice to have the kitchen and kitchette's available. They had movies downstairs that were available for your use in your room. The breakfast was an added treat.

review.title: Great Hotel, Very Impressed!
review.reviewText: Hotel is amazing small but very comfortable. Will definitely stay there again very close to the SF Airport. Very quiet and cozy very well maintained.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Generally good hotel. Free internet, breakfast, spacious room. The only downside is the lack of amenities around the hotel especially food choices. Food at hotel across the parking lot is ok, but not good value.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: This was a great find - a few miles from SFO; really comfy, spacious rooms; helpful friendly staff. Only downside was the couple in the room above that had a major screaming fight at 2.30am! (But hardly the hotel's fault and when I said something at check out the next morning, the staff member was mortified and said if I'd rung them at the time they would have tried to sort it out).

review.title: Great place especially for business travelers
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because it was centrally located to the places we wanted to visit and I would highly recommend it for leisure. For the business traveller it would really shine with high speed wireless internet, business center and very nice kitchen area in the room. All of the staff were courteous and very helpful with recommedations for restaurants etc. I have stayed at other nice motels in the area but will come back to this one.

review.title: Very Good Experience
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel by the reviews and was not at all disappointed. In fact, the clean and nicely decorated room was more like a studio apartment, offering every imaginable convenience at a good price. Most importantly, it was clean. Beds were fantastic and DVD's were provided at no cost. Breakfast was generous and the staff was helpful and very courteous. I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Incredible hotel!!!!!
review.reviewText: This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The reviews we had read on it before going were all true -- it deserves at least a four-star rating! We plan to stay in Larkspur Landing hotels in other cities, now. The only recommendation we would have for them is to enlarge the breakfast area -- it gets pretty crowded and is hard to get to the fridge, etc. The amenities of the rooms were wonderful --DVD player, awesome bed, great kitchen, nice soap/shampoos.... We're already telling our friends about this place.

review.title: Not bad for the cost
review.reviewText: Decent sized room with an adequate kitchen. The breakfast buffet has a good variety of items although the quality is average at best. The fresh baked cookies were a nice touch. Read lots of reviews about how great the beds are at this hotel, but I thought they were OK, nothing too special. Fairly close to San Francisco and for the price this hotel is not bad. For the same price or a little higher, you can get a much nicer and more spacious suite at other hotels.

review.title: great business hotel for South San Fran
review.reviewText: Larkspur is a best interpretation of the business suite hotel i have stayed in. The rooms are like one bedroom apartments, really. Full kitchenette with breakfast bar and counter space, big work desk, full length couch and side chair with ottoman. Washroom is large with double sinks and big counterspace. The furniture is non-hotel-like. They offer free laundry room which i took advantage of during an extended trip. Nice workout room that you can actually use. Staff was helpful and free shuttle to the airport.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for the price. Since we were renting a car, staying in South SF was not a problem. It only took us 15 minutes to get to the heart of SF. I was expecting just the basics, but we got so much more. Our room had a kitchenette and down pillows/comforter. It was quiet, clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly. I'll definitely go back.

review.title: Great Hotel outside of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is the best place to stay if you are visiting San Francisco. They have a shuttle to the airport for the BART, and are only a few minutes away from downtown if you have a car. There was a DVD player in the room, nice outdoor hot tub with music playing, great continental breakfast, and a very helpful staff. Driving to Fisherman's Wharf was the only expensive place to park. We drove to the Haight and found parking with no problem. We also went out in Downtown SF on a Friday night and found a spot on the street without too much trouble. Be brave and drive around the block a few times. The rooms are not huge, but in comparison to other SF hotels these are giant. The value of what you get at this hotel makes it so worth it. Beds are comfy too..

review.title: 5 star service/amenities
review.reviewText: We normally try to stay at a 4 star hotel but looking at the hotel rooms and other areas of hotel and reading the other reviews, we decided to go for it and the price was definitely right! The staff was highly hospitable, very helpful and often vulunteered to help out with directions and bookings, etc. The hotel itself was very clean, the bed was very comfortable. The sofa bed wasn't as comfortable so my 13 year old said. I was really impressed with all the complimentary services like the free continental breakfast that you can take back to your room if you wish(saved us money. They had complimentary cookies and lemonade in the afternoons and complimentary starbucks coffee 24hrs a day! They also had complimentary fruits throughtout the day! Talk about savings! They had complimentary grocery shopping, no charge for the service,just your groceries, on site laundry room, no charge for using machines just have to buy your soap. With kids and being able to come back with clean clothes was a definite plus! Workout room was small but there was usually no one there so we were able to use equipment freely. Did I mention they had complimentary internet access in room and also had a small business center which you could use freely and it was complimentary! Fax service, internet, use of computer. Great great hotel, it felt very much like "home".

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, lovely staff and a great continental breakfast, wish we could have stayed longer
review.reviewText: We have never been to SF and the staff sat with us and halp us find routes that were best for us. The room and lobby were wonderfully clean and very well decorated. Starbucks coffe is a plus, expecially 24 hours of it. This Hotel is great.

review.title: Just like home
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff was quite helpful. Room was very comfortable. The ameneties at the hotel was tremendous. Convenient to freeway on/off ramps. Had a great stay!

review.title: Relaxing
review.reviewText: If your looking to relax and get away from all the hustle and bustle this is the place for you. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the rooms are clean, and inviting.

review.title: Best choice for SFO
review.reviewText: We drove from Reno to this hotel near San Francisco Airport the night before the flight to guarantee getting to the airport on time. We had the smallest room which was very comfortable for two people. Our room was suppose to have a queen size bed but it had a king size instead

review.title: Would definitely stay again
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and nicely furnished. Will stay again next time I take my family to SF

review.title: Superb Hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here in June 2006 on 2 week holday to SF. Was in one of their "BR Exec Suite" rooms. The room was great, about the size of a small flat, with a seperate bedroom, living room and kitchen area. All very clean and well furnished. Kitchen had full size fridge freezer, hobs (no oven only microwave) and even a dishwasher. Staff could not have been more frendly and helpful. Breakfast good, if don't need a full fry-up each morning - although got a bit samey after two weeks. Cookies in evening appreciated. Location near airport (did not notice any noise from it) and Highway 101 which gave good access to Bay area. Free use of internet in lobby area let us keep in touch with those at home. Only criticism was that maids came round a bit early (8am) so hang "Do not disturb" sign out.

review.title: Inexpensive nice room
review.reviewText: Has no pool but has hot tub. Had queen Suite room with kitchenette. staff very cooperative,courteous and helpful. No on site resturant but for good economic comfort very good choice

review.title: Awesome Hotel
review.reviewText: This is the one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff was extremely nice. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The bed was absolutely wonderful. If you are going to San Francisco, stay at this hotel. You will save a bunch of money by not staying in the city. It's right off the freeway and easy to find. Will definately reccommend this hotel.

review.title: Home away from Home
review.reviewText: This hotel felt like home. The place is neat and clean and plenty of complimentary nibbles upon arrival and the next morning. Check in and sit back and relax. I like the choice of listening to music, watching a DVD, surfing the net or preparing and eating a meal right in my room utilizing the modern furnished kitchenette. I will check room rates and availability at Larkspur before checking anywhere else first for my next trip.

review.title: Larkspur is the only way to travel
review.reviewText: I will always stay at a Larkspur Hotel if given the chance. Their Featherborne beds are fabulous. Best nights sleep in a hotel I've ever had. Don't be discouraged by the 3 stars. It's definitely a 4+ star without an inhouse restaurant and lounge.

review.title: excellent hotel with the exception of the shuttle
review.reviewText: Loved everything about the hotel. Excellent accomodations, snacks, etc....the only thing was the shuttle service. The hotel does not have enough shuttle to run on a more frequent basis unlike the majority of the major hotels, with a shuttle present at the airport almost every 15 minutes. The shuttle drivers were not friendly, nor accomodating. Did not volunteer any kind of info about the airports shuttle service as to where the visitor was located for a more precise pick up point. One time we had to wait 45 minutes for a shuttle. The hotel, accomodations are all excellent. Would have rated the hotel a five but the shuttle service needs improvement.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to the airport, however, not very close anything else. The shuttle was running every hour and the driver was not very friendly! The hotel staff was very helpful in giving us ideas (i.e. restaurants, etc.)

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived at the San Francisco International on Friday. Called the Larkspur shuttle, they were there within few minutes. Checked in, went in the room. I was very surprised to see the room being very nice. Extra clean and just fantastic. Great shampoo, soap, lotion. Complimentary coffee and chocolate. We even ordered room service, great dinner. This hotel to me is better than most 4 star hotels in San Francisco. I would love to go back to San Francisco and I will make sure I stay at Larkspur.

review.title: Great Hotel Outside San Francisco
review.reviewText: My new husband and I chose this hotel for the San Francisco portion of our honeymoon. We were very pleased that we did. After researching all of the hotels in the San Francisco area, the Larkspur was definitely the best deal for us. We had rented a car since we were driving to other cities during our trip, so the free parking was a big bonus in a city where most hotels charge $40/day to park. The drive into San Francisco was only 10 minutes, well worth it to us. The Larkspur has free laundry facilities (note to hotel: please provide dryer sheets vs. liquid softener - hard to time the rinse cycle!), fully equipped kitchens (no running to the ice machine!), a business center and fresh baked cookies in the lobby every night. The bed was the most comfortable we have ever slept on - they even had a pillow menu (which we didn't use since the 6 on the bed were perfect)! The Bath and Body Works toiletries were a nice touch. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Excellent Value and Cleanliness
review.reviewText: Great Hotel for the Business traveler. Reasonable, clean and great staff.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: We thought this was a very nice hotel. If you are staying for an extended period of time there is a kitchen with utensils, dishes etc. Although this hotel is near the airport we weren't able to hear the noise of the planes.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. It was clean, well decorated and well appointed. The amenities were well suited for business travel and pleasure. A fully stocked kitchen and free washing and drying made the hotel well suited for long stays. The atmosphere was pleasant, and the staff were friendly. The breakfast was good and we had access to a restaurant in the adjacent hotel. There were however no other restaurants or stores in walking distance. A hotel shuttle to the airport provides easy access to the BART and extensive public transport network.

review.title: Very helpful
review.reviewText: Desk clerk was very pleasant and helpful, giving me a map to my final destination.

review.title: Wonderful home away from home...
review.reviewText: Stayed in an Executive Apartment with bedroom, living area, full kitchen. It was the perfect size for myself and my teenager. My bed was extremely comfortable. My teenager loved the extra feather-bed matress (used it on the pullout sofa) we found in the closet. Staff was very helpful and courteous, and it was close enough to the City to venture out every evening for dinner. They also provide a free shuttle to/from the BART station at the airport for travelers without a car.

review.title: Diamond in the rough
review.reviewText: I have plenty of funds to stay at a hotel with more stars, but the Larskpur is condusive to the busy traveller (me!). After long flights and seriously long work days, I have to say that the beds are the best feature... quiet, comfortable, great service, not too busy, free parking, excellent breakfast, and simply amazing beds. The only draw-back is a serious lack of eating options in the area and the computers in the business room are worthless. It's only 15-20 minutes from dwntwn SF and 5 minutes from the airport.

review.title: Would Definitely Return
review.reviewText: This hotel was great, especially for the price. It was definitely a benefit having a full kitchen available. The rooms were generously sized and had many useful amenities, such as a dvd player, full ironing board and iron, complimentary snacks, and of course, the Starbuck's coffee! We would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was a very good place to stay, close to the airport, close to the BART station, hotel provided shuttle to airport and BART station within fifteen minutes of hotel. BART provided easy access to the main tourist spots, and was easy to use. Plus the hotel provided fresh cookies every evening and a continental breakfast every morning. Only complaints - easy to hear noise in other rooms and lack of space where breakfast was served. Would definitely recommend and would go back again.

review.title: Would Definitely Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: This hotel was beautiful!  The front desk staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful, even calling up to our room after we checked in to make sure everything looked okay and we had everything we needed.  Business center with internet, 24 hour Starbucks coffee in lobby, fitness center and outdoor spa were all nice as well.  The room was very spacious and clean with a full kitchen.  I would definitely stay here again!

review.title: excellent value
review.reviewText: Well appointed rooms, the one bedroom suite has lots of room in the kitchen, sitting area, and bedroom. Large two-sink bathroom with lots of ammenities. Stylish and comfy!

review.title: Best stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Since I was in San Francisco for a very brief period of time (5 days), and it was my  first time I stayed in Larkspur Landing, I was really satisfied with the Larkspur.
The bathroom was impeccably clean.  Of course the room was clean but the bathroom just impressed me with its cleanliness. The choice of  tiles, curtain and overall decor and style gave one the feeling that the management really gave their best to make the guests feel so comfortable and at home. The bed and pillows just made me stay longer in bed and ended up sleeping  almost the whole day. I shall definitely recommend Larkspur to friends and family and when I go back to San Francisco, it will be a must for me to stay at least 2 nights at Larkspur.

review.title: Stop looking... this place is *perfect*
review.reviewText: You can easily waste a lot of time looking for a hotel, especially in the San Francisco Bay area.  Do yourself a favor, quit looking, and book this place.  It is an extremely convenient, pleasant place to stay, especially for families.  The service is outstanding, which really sets this place apart.

review.title: Comfortable, Clean, Close to Airport
review.reviewText: We only stayed at this hotel one night - we wanted to be close to the airport as we had an early morning flight out.  It was very comfortable, clean, and quiet despite its close proximity to the airport.  We checked in late and the room we reserved was not available, but we were promptly upgraded to a huge suite at no extra charge.  We were disappointed that our stay wasn't longer!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel has excellent comfort.  Service was great and not to mention they have Starbucks coffee 24 hours a day fresh!  I am staying here everytime I go back to San Mateo.

review.title: Would Go Again in a Second
review.reviewText: This was one of the larger suites I've stayed in (600 sq. ft.).  It was wonderful to have a separate bedroom.  The kids loved that as much as my husband and I did!  The kitchen was clean and adequately equipped for us to do most of our own cooking.  They have a collection of classic books and music available.  I read a classic I've heard of but never read before...very relaxing. We all loved the exercise room, and we took advantage of the pool, hot tub and restaurant at the hotel next door.  Nice breakfast every morning, Starbucks coffee in lobby all day, chocolate chip cookies every evening... We'll definitely go back!

review.title: Wonderful place to stay but...
review.reviewText: My husband, 2 kids and I stayed in a beautiful, roomy suite.  The hotel staff was the friendliest and most helpful I've encountered in some time.  The only problem was the heater/air conditioner unit seemed to run all the time no matter how we adjusted it.

review.title: A Wonderful cozy Hotel
review.reviewText:
Our experience of this hotel was wonderful.
The staffs are nicea and friendly.
Rooms are new and clean.
We enjoyed that 24 hrs starbucks coffee a lot.
We will definitely recommend this hotel to all our friends.

review.title: Very good hotel in San Francisco surrounding area
review.reviewText:
Very confortable hotel, very clean rooms, and very friendly staff
There not a good place for breakfast; some problems with shuttle to the airport

review.title: Top Quality
review.reviewText: Excellent location and if you can find a reduced rate on expedia for this hotel it is well worth the stay.  Quality from service to accommodations.  I have used the Larkspur on many occasions and would not hesitate to recommend it to any traveler.

review.title: too good to believe
review.reviewText: we couldn't believe how big our room was for the price.  the service was great and if we'd known how nice the place was we would have stayed there all week instead of spending twice as much for half the space.
